definition[0]: to make steady progress and become more popular, more successful etc
example[0]: The anti-smoking lobby has steadily gained ground in the last decade.
example[1]: It was feared that the extreme right would gain ground in the election.
definition[2]: if an idea, belief etc gains ground, more people start to accept it
example[2]: His theories gradually gained ground among academics.
definition[3]: to get closer to someone or something that you are competing with
